venue.address_2: cross street Center between Chapel and Crown
venue.name: Bentara

item.description:
Petcha Kutcha

It has been a while since we have been to one of these, they are loads of fun...Come down and see what is in the works with entrepreneurs, and creative minds in our own community.  I have listed presenters below, looks like some interesting ideas.
This is a well attended event (always a packed house), get there early (5:30 or earlier), if you can so we can hold a table. Late arrivers may have to stand.

PechaKucha Night - volume 10 
New Haven has it's own edition of PechaKucha Night, an event that celebrates creativity and innovation. It was founded by designers in Tokyo as a way to share ideas succinctly and creatively. The event has grown to include anyone and everyone in cities around the world; individuals or groups present creative ideas or innovations using 20 images shown for 20 seconds each. The ideas can solve social problems or just be a cool innovation, or new project. Neighbors, colleagues, journalists, designers, architects, social entrepreneurs, and artists have all presented at PechaKucha nights. Check out our New Haven page (and the global website) for more info:
http://www.pecha-kuch...

Presented by PKN

6:30pm 8:20.

[Admission is:  $ free!  But you’ll need your usual amount for the bar and food…]

Autumn Edition presenters will include:

  • Fran McMullen takes us from Branford to Old Saybrook, via Sunset,
  • David Lewin speaks to Intellectual Property with Poetic License,
  • Jeff Mooney tells us about WeGov as fostered by CityCamp (coming to New Haven next Spring),
  • Susan Clinard and Lucy Mackintosh on Private Workspace people create to nurture Inventive pastimes,
  • Richard Kuslan teaches us about Learning Mandarin Effectively,
  • Darrell Petit talks about Sculpture,
  • Alison Weir on how our values translate into… Diapers,
  • Adam Wascholl tells us about Building an Intentional Community,
  • Dave Coon tells Tales of Yankee Power,
  • Matthew Stadler on print-on-demand’s potential to add to all aspects of the literature world,
  • Derek Koch tells us what happens at StartupWeekend,
  • and Juli Stupakevich on a pedestrian- and cyclist-inclusive vision for New Haven.
item.how_to_find_us: will wear the bw scarf with piano keys
item.name: Petcha Kutcha
